attributes.action: urgently intervene in the case of Naheem Hussain and Reham Zaman, British nationals facing the death penalty in Pakistan, to prevent evidence obtained by torture being admitted at their trial.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Reprieve are assisting Naheem and Rehan, two young British men that were brutally tortured by the police while in custody in Pakistan. The two men 'confessed' to the crime only after facing severe beatings, being burned and having fingernails pulled out. We are asking that the Prime Minister ensures that the 'evidence' obtained in this manner is excluded from their trials. 

Additionally Reprieve are asking the British Government to put pressure on the Pakistani government to ensure that a full enquiry is undertaken into the torture, and that those who perpetrated and authorised it are brought to justice.
